text:
Lo que va colgando Otto... yo no me voy enterando de que o como lo está haciendo. Solo con mod_harbour, imagino, y con algun boostrap o similar.
Pero me interesaria "entender" que está haciendo, como lo está haciendo y si seria de compartir su manera de hacer/avanzar.

text:
At the moment, I only tested with a gallery. But it works fine.
I convert the emails, PDF, RTF, etc into JPG.
It's not a very clean solution, but it works well.
We open Word in reading mode and then I take a screenshot with FIVEWIN,
You can read everything on these previews because they are big enough. You can then open the original document with a click.
Please look in the video on how fast you can browse the documents.
As I said, I use the file system and not a database.

elements.text:
At the moment, I only tested with a gallery. But it works fine.
I convert the emails, PDF, RTF, etc into JPG.
It's not a very clean solution, but it works well.
We open Word in reading mode and then I take a screenshot with FIVEWIN,
You can read everything on these previews because they are big enough. You can then open the original document with a click.
Please look in the video on how fast you can browse the documents.
As I said, I use the file system and not a database.

text:
Security
Data at rest encryption
Do you think it is possible that with PEEKWORD (), POKEBYTE ()
can enter the password for encryption in the memory and then have it read by the mod harbor applications.

elements.text:
Security
Data at rest encryption
Do you think it is possible that with PEEKWORD (), POKEBYTE ()
can enter the password for encryption in the memory and then have it read by the mod harbor applications.

text: Is there any reason you need to read the data from memory? It's surely not a matter of keeping secrets safe, since your servers are at home.

elements.text: Is there any reason you need to read the data from memory? It's surely not a matter of keeping secrets safe, since your servers are at home.

text:
Error: Unknown or unregistered symbol
operation: POKEBYTE

elements.text:
Error: Unknown or unregistered symbol
operation: POKEBYTE

text: Yes, hacking and downloading files.

elements.text: Yes, hacking and downloading files.

text: If you've configured apache correctly, the prg's shouldn't be downloadable

elements.text: If you've configured apache correctly, the prg's shouldn't be downloadable

text: about hacking... well, if a hacker has admin access to your computer, hiding secrets in memory won't stop them

elements.text: about hacking... well, if a hacker has admin access to your computer, hiding secrets in memory won't stop them

text: Sure it stops as at his server he has no password to decrypt.

elements.text: Sure it stops as at his server he has no password to decrypt.

text: Or if someone steals the whole system.

elements.text: Or if someone steals the whole system.

text: It's relatively easy to inspect a process's memory when you have admin access to the OS

elements.text: It's relatively easy to inspect a process's memory when you have admin access to the OS

text: Which means you should rather watch out for any paths through which a hacker can enter your system and escalate privileges.

elements.text: Which means you should rather watch out for any paths through which a hacker can enter your system and escalate privileges.

text: Rather than coming up with elaborate schemes to hide a secret which are easily bypassed.

elements.text: Rather than coming up with elaborate schemes to hide a secret which are easily bypassed.

text: But I'm no security expert, don't take my opinions on that topic as professional advice

elements.text: But I'm no security expert, don't take my opinions on that topic as professional advice

text: To be fair, storing secrets in program code _is_ dangerous when you're uploading that code somewhere, be it github, azure, or any other hosting, since any admins for those services could look at the code.

elements.text: To be fair, storing secrets in program code
is
dangerous when you're uploading that code somewhere, be it github, azure, or any other hosting, since any admins for those services could look at the code.

text: But on a local server, not really.

elements.text: But on a local server, not really.

text: This is the solution if someone steals the whole system.

elements.text: This is the solution if someone steals the whole system.

text: If someone has access to the whole system, they also have access to the memory.

elements.text: If someone has access to the whole system, they also have access to the memory.

text: But then they have to carry the running system to their place.

elements.text: But then they have to carry the running system to their place.

text: Except that accessing the memory can be done with privilege escalation once a hacker has access to the system.

elements.text: Except that accessing the memory can be done with privilege escalation once a hacker has access to the system.

text: Bottom line, have an antivirus and keep your OS updated.

elements.text: Bottom line, have an antivirus and keep your OS updated.

text: And having a firewall is good practice.

elements.text: And having a firewall is good practice.

text: But there comes a point where further security gives diminishing returns. And I don't think storing secrets in memory in your case will give any significant returns.

elements.text: But there comes a point where further security gives diminishing returns. And I don't think storing secrets in memory in your case will give any significant returns.

text: You're better off makign sure you don't have XSS or SQL injection vulns in your code.

elements.text: You're better off makign sure you don't have XSS or SQL injection vulns in your code.

text: I'm thinking, for example, of people who steal the backup disk. That is very easy.

elements.text: I'm thinking, for example, of people who steal the backup disk. That is very easy.

text: Okay, you're right in that, but there are other kinds of attacks.

elements.text: Okay, you're right in that, but there are other kinds of attacks.

text: FTPS - SFTP what is state of the art and which upload/download software should you use.

elements.text: FTPS - SFTP what is state of the art and which upload/download software should you use.

text: They're different things, both secure extensions of FTP

elements.text: They're different things, both secure extensions of FTP

text: For SFTP you need SSH, which isn't very well supported on Windows environments, but it's more secure.

elements.text: For SFTP you need SSH, which isn't very well supported on Windows environments, but it's more secure.

text: FTPS is basically just FTP over an encrypted connection, much like HTTPS. It won't make the FTP login more secure but at least it prevents attackers from seeing the login details.

elements.text: FTPS is basically just FTP over an encrypted connection, much like HTTPS. It won't make the FTP login more secure but at least it prevents attackers from seeing the login details.
